0.title: Pak are laying a foundation too deep; unnecessary in T20s: Sanjay
0.article_body: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar commented on the middle order of the Pakistan T20 side in the ongoing Asia Cup. "They (Pakistan) are laying too deep a foundation. For a 20-over innings, it's unnecessary," Manjrekar said. He added, "What's more it...[needs to] give more opportunity to number four, five [and] six, thereby making Pakistan a more wholesome batting unit."

1.title: 48-year-old IVRI employee dies while dancing at birthday party in UP, video surfaces
1.article_body: Prabhat Kumar, a 48-year-old man working at Indian Veterinary Research Institute (IVRI) in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, died while dancing at a birthday party. A video has surfaced on social media showing Prabhat performing a solo dance and suddenly collapsing mid-way. He was then rushed to a hospital, where the doctors declared him dead. He reportedly suffered a severe heart attack.

2.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
2.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, has issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states. Very heavy rainfall is likely over some parts of Karnataka and Kerala on September 6 and 7. It is likely over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on September 6. Parts of Arunachal Pradesh, West Bengal, Sikkim and Uttarakhand may witness very heavy rainfall tomorrow.

3.title: 'RRR' actress Ahmareen Anjum ties the knot with actor Danny Sura, shares pics
3.article_body: Actress Ahmareen Anjum, who played a character named Loki in Rajamouli's 'RRR', tied the knot with actor Danny Sura in Kolkata on August 20. Taking to Instagram on Saturday, Ahmareen shared a series of pictures from her wedding ceremony and wrote, "Fortunate to have found my soulmate...We seek your love [and] blessings as we embark on this new journey together!"

4.title: Opposition will unify for 2024 elections: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
4.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar called for Opposition's unity in 2024 elections and said there is a need to think about how BJP is allegedly poaching MLAs from other parties. "When we parted ways from the NDA, all our six Manipur MLAs came...and assured us they were with JDU," said Kumar. He further questioned the constitutionality of the alleged poaching.

5.title: Six debt-ridden farmers die by suicide within 24 hours in Vidarbha
5.article_body: Six debt-ridden farmers died by suicide in Maharashtra's Vidarbha region within a 24-hour period on Friday and Saturday. A state government body said the farmers' crops were ruined due to the unprecedented rains and they failed to get fresh loans to sow their fields. Vidarbha has seen the most farmer deaths by suicide in Maharashtra in the past two years.

6.title: Sitharaman scolds Collector over no pic of PM at ration shop in T'gana, video surfaces
6.article_body: A video shows Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman scolding Kamareddy District Collector Jitesh Patil when he couldn't provide an answer to what the Centre and state's share was in the rice supplied through fair price shops. She also asked why PM Modi's picture was missing at a shop. "Our people will come and put up...PM's banner here," she told him.

7.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar can never become PM in his life: BJP MP Sushil Modi
7.article_body: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Sushil Kumar Modi on Saturday said Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar can never become Prime Minister in his life. "Posters and hoardings don't make anyone the Prime Minister. If a leader only has 5-10 MPs from his party, how can he become...PM?" he said, adding Nitish broke alliance with NDA just to remain in news.

8.title: Johar touches Nagarjuna's feet at event, says 'Dad was a friend of Nag sir'
8.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, during a promotional event for 'Brahmastra' in Hyderabad, touched the feet of Nagarjuna who also marked his presence along with Jr NTR and SS Rajamouli. "My father was a dear friend of Nag sir, and I feel that legacy of love continues," Johar said. He added that Nagarjuna was the "favourite person" on the sets of 'Brahmastra'.

9.title: We all knew you were the greatest: LeBron James on Serena Williams
9.article_body: Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James termed 23-time Grand Slam Champion Serena Williams as "unbelievable", adding he can speak about her journey for "an hour". "We all knew you were the greatest...It's been an honour to watch...you conquer all the goals...you ever set out, to see you break records," stated James. "What...you have done for women...is unprecedented," he said.

10.title: 150-foot-wide asteroid to pass past the Earth today: NASA
10.article_body: A gigantic killer asteroid named 2022 QO31 is going to pass past the Earth on September 3, NASA said. The asteroid will pass from 5.3 million kilometres away from the Earth. However, if any last-minute deviation takes place, the 150-foot-wide asteroid can reach the Earth in two days. It is travelling at a speed of 30,420 kmph.

11.title: Ukraine's attempt to seize nuclear plant thwarted, claims Russia
11.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry on Saturday claimed that its forces on Friday night thwarted the Ukrainian military's attempt to capture the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant. Over 250 troops of Ukraine's Navy attempted a landing on the coast of a lake near the plant, the ministry said. Russian forces foiled the attack with strikes from military helicopters and fighter jets, it added.

12.title: 6, including lady gang leader, charged under Gangster Act in UP
12.article_body: Six people, including a lady gang leader along with her husband, have been booked under the Gangster Act in Mainpuri, UP. The police had recently arrested members of a robbery gang, which was headed by the female accused, identified as Vineeta, police said. Vineeta used to travel on e-rickshaws and intoxicate fellow travellers before stealing their belongings, police added.

13.title: 11-yr-old boy killed as wall collapses in UP's Bareilly
13.article_body: An 11-year-old boy, identified as Gaurav Kumar, was killed in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly on Saturday after a wall of his neighbour's house collapsed on him while he was playing, police said. Another boy was injured in the incident. Neighbours pulled the boys out of the debris and took them to a hospital where Gaurav was declared dead, the SP said.

14.title: Teacher, headmaster arrested for assaulting student in Rajasthan
14.article_body: A teacher and a headmaster of a private school in Rajasthan's Sikar have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a student. Police said the Class 12 student was allegedly slapped by his teacher for not following instructions to stand in line properly during a prayer meeting. Later, he was allegedly thrashed by both the accused, the victim's family claims.

15.title: If Kerala has a future, it's BJP: Amit Shah in Thiruvananthapuram
15.article_body: Addressing the southern zonal council meeting in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said if the state has a future, it's the BJP. "Congress is vanishing from the country, the world is getting rid of communist parties," Shah said. "Congress...and the Communists never worked for the welfare of the Scheduled Tribes and the poor," Shah added.

16.title: Need to make educational institutions future ready: President Murmu
16.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Saturday said there is a need to make educational institutions future ready with new teaching and learning metrics, pedagogy and content. Addressing the closing ceremony of Diamond Jubilee celebrations of Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi, President Murmu called IITs the country's pride and said, "Their story is the story of independent India."

17.title: Afghanistan have all their bases covered, confidence is high: Jaffer
17.article_body: Former India batter Wasim Jaffer said that the Afghanistan team have "covered all their bases". "The [Afghanistan] batters are playing well, they have world-class spinners and the pacers have done well too," Jaffer said. He added, "So,...the confidence is high considering they defeated both their opponents [in the group stage]...Afghanistan is definitely the favourites to win [against Sri Lanka]."

18.title: British tourists charged ₹112 for using toilet at Agra railway station
18.article_body: Two British tourists were reportedly charged ₹112 each for using washroom in the executive lounge of the Agra Cantt railway station. The amount included 12% GST as well. As per reports, IRCTC clarified it's a mandatory fee charged by the executive lounge, after which a passenger can stay inside for two hours, use free wifi and also avail free coffee.

19.title: Minister came to hotel & stayed till 2 am, took voters to 1 floor: Bhutia on AIFF elections
19.article_body: After losing the AIFF elections to Kalyan Chaubey, ex-captain Bhaichung Bhutia said he was shocked as he didn't expect political interference of "high level". "If they (his opponents) were...confident...why a powerful Union Minister had to come at...hotel (where voters were staying)...and stay there till 2 am in...morning of election day...and take all of them to particular floor," Bhutia stated.

20.title: Dalit student hit with metal rod, broom for touching UP teacher's bike
20.article_body: A Class 6 Dalit student in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia was allegedly locked up in a classroom and beaten with a metal rod and a broom by his teacher for touching the latter's motorcycle, police said on Saturday. The other staff of the school rescued the boy, police added. According to a Basic Shiksha Adhikari, the accused teacher has been suspended.

21.title: Ravindra Jadeja's knee injury serious, set to miss T20 World Cup 2022: Reports
21.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is set to miss T20 World Cup 2022 as he'll undergo a knee surgery, reports said. "Jadeja's right knee injury is pretty serious. He's supposed to undergo a major knee surgery and will be out of action for indefinite period of time," a senior BCCI official told PTI. The T20 WC 2022 will begin next month.

22.title: Lakhs of people to attend rally against price rise: Cong leader Venugopal
22.article_body: Talking about 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress MP KC Venugopal said they're (Congress) set for a massive rally against price rise which will be attended by lakhs of people. "This agitation started 2021 onwards, we can proudly say we are the party that's fighting against price rise in the country," he said. The Yatra will take place from Kanyakumari to Srinagar.

23.title: Take steps to galvanise economy: Kerala CM to Centre
23.article_body: Speaking at the 30th southern zonal council meeting, chaired by Union Minister Amit Shah, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan urged the Centre to enable the states to "undertake productive spending to galvanise the national economy". "The fiscal empowerment of the Union and the states are of equal importance to meet the long impact of the pandemic on the economy," he said.

24.title: 18 killed in al-Shabaab attack in Somalia, food aid trucks burnt
24.article_body: At least 18 civilians were killed in an overnight attack by al-Shabaab militants in Somalia's central region, the country's state news agency reported on Saturday. The al-Shabaab fighters also burnt several trucks carrying food aid, the report added. According to media reports, "most of the people on board the vehicles (relief food trucks)" were killed in the attack.

25.title: 7 torch vehicles over complaint against Bengal headmaster; arrested
25.article_body: The West Bengal Police on Saturday arrested seven persons for torching vehicles and creating unrest in Purba Medinipur over a corruption complaint against a school headmaster, Nandakumar SHO Manoj Kumar Jhano said. Police personnel, who were attacked by students and locals when they tried to control the situation, had to resort to lathicharge to disperse the mob, the SHO added.

26.title: They see beauty in everything: Nawazuddin on female directors
26.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui, while sharing his experience of working with female directors, said that women look at the world differently. He added that they are far more compassionate and see beauty in everything. Nawazuddin has worked with several female directors, including Nandita Das, Anusha Rizvi, Zoya Akhtar, Reema Kagti and Debamitra Biswal.

27.title: NGT orders Bengal to pay ₹3,500 crore for gap in waste management
27.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has imposed a penalty of ₹3,500 crore on the West Bengal government for allegedly not managing solid and liquid waste, causing harm to the environment. Continuing damage is required to be prevented in the future and past damage is to be restored, the bench said. The penalty is to be paid within two months.

28.title: Thank you for inspiring all of us to pursue our dreams: Woods on Serena
28.article_body: Talking about Serena Williams whose defeat against Ajla Tomljanovic in the US Open marked the last match of her career, golfer Tiger Woods tweeted, "Thank you for inspiring all of us to pursue our dreams." "How lucky were we to...watch a young girl from Compton...become one of the greatest athletes of all time," tweeted former US First Lady Michelle Obama.

29.title: Cleric passing info on military to Pakistan arrested by J&K Police
29.article_body: J&K Police have, with inputs from Military Intelligence, arrested a local cleric from a mosque in Kishtwar for allegedly running a terror-cum-espionage module. Abdul Wahid was reportedly working for terror group Kashmir Janbaaz Force, which is being controlled by Pakistan. The 22-year-old cleric was allegedly passing information on military deployment and movement to his contact across the border.

30.title: Liquor sale banned in certain areas of Bengaluru during this weekend
30.article_body: In view of the Ganesh Chaturthi's idol immersion processions over this weekend, the Bengaluru Police have prohibited the sale of liquor in certain areas of the city. The areas are located across three police divisions namely the eastern, north-eastern and northern divisions of Bengaluru. However, the dates of the prohibition order's implementation vary across areas.

31.title: Govt shares pics of 'future look' of New Delhi Railway Station, Twitter users react
31.article_body: Ministry of Railways shared photos of the proposed design of the to-be redeveloped New Delhi Railway Station. While some Twitter users appreciated the modern architecture, one comment read, "This looks great but seems like 2050 plan looking at the amount of land acquisition/development this requires." "Glass building in heat of...Delhi...Just wasting money," another comment read.

32.title: Kartik Aaryan, Kiara Advani begin shooting for 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha'
32.article_body: Director Sameer Vidwans' 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha', starring Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani, went on floors on Saturday. The actors took to their respective Instagram handles to share the news, writing, "Sattu Aur Katha. Love Story Begins Today." The film is a musical love story that brings Kartik and Kiara together for the second time after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

33.title: Hyd BJP Corporator arrested for allegedly kidnapping 22-yr-old man
33.article_body: Baddam Prem Maheshwar Reddy, BJP Corporator from Hyderabad's Gaddiannaram, was arrested on Saturday in connection with the alleged kidnapping of a 22-year-old man from PNT Colony. Earlier, police traced the man to Nalgonda and made three arrests. While interrogating the arrested men, police learnt that Reddy had pre-planned the kidnap and made arrangements for a car to abduct the man.

34.title: Tenure extension of St Stephen's principal illegal: DU
34.article_body: Delhi University (DU) has told St Stephen's College's Chairman, its Supreme Council and Governing Body that its Principal John Varghese is continuing illegally in the post since March 2021. DU said the college did not follow University Grants Commission regulations when extending his term. DU said it found the college's Supreme Council violating due processes and procedures.

35.title: 18-yr-old Gauff, 28-yr-old Garcia reach their maiden 4th round at US Open
35.article_body: US' Coco Gauff and France's Caroline Garcia entered the fourth round at the US Open for the first time in their career on Friday. The 18-year-old American, who is playing in her third US Open, beat compatriot Madison Keys 6-2, 6-3 in the third round, while the 28-year-old Frenchwoman defeated former champion Bianca Andreescu 6-3, 6-2.

36.title: Court issues contempt notice to Delhi Police Commissioner in rape case
36.article_body: A Delhi court has issued a contempt notice to Police Commissioner, Delhi, in an alleged gangrape case. The bench noted Sangam Vihar Police Station registered the FIR in the case after 36 days of the victim filing a complaint before the Station House Officer. The court said this "depicted a sordid and pathetic state of affairs" in Delhi Police's administration.

37.title: Pilot allegedly steals plane, threatens to crash it into US Walmart store; video surfaces
37.article_body: A pilot allegedly stole an aircraft and threatened to crash it into a Walmart store in US' Tupelo. The police evacuated the buildings and asked citizens to avoid the area. Several users on Twitter shared videos showing the plane flying in circles over homes and businesses. All emergency services in the area are on alert.

38.title: Class 2 boy mauled by 2 pitbulls in Bengaluru, his face disfigured
38.article_body: Two pitbulls reportedly attacked a Class 2 student for the second time in around seven months in Bengaluru. His father claimed that the dogs' owner, who lives in the same building as the seven-year-old boy, had provoked the dogs to attack the child during an argument. "My son's face has been disfigured...He needed 58 stitches...His condition is critical," he added.

39.title: Pune leading shift to alternative transport fuel: Fadnavis
39.article_body: The Maharashtra government is shifting public transport to alternate fuel and Pune is leading the change, Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said. "The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) is leading the change with 650...electric buses, which implies that 30% of PMPML transportation is using alternative fuel," he said. Fadnavis spoke at an electric bus depot launch in Pune.

40.title: Delhi Police personnel assaulted in road rage incident
40.article_body: A Delhi Police head constable was allegedly assaulted by two motorcycle-borne men in Delhi's Vikaspuri area in a road rage incident on Thursday. According to police, the victim was travelling in his car when he was signalled to stop by a motorcycle rider. The biker and his pillion rider assaulted the victim after complaining about his driving, police said.

41.title: Bengaluru Police bust car stealing racket; 2 arrested
41.article_body: The Bengaluru Police have arrested two people for running a car stealing racket across Delhi and Bengaluru. The accused used to steal cars and then change their number plates and chassis numbers, police said. Nine cars worth around ₹1.2 crore have been recovered by the police. The DCP (Bengaluru Central Division) RS Gowda congratulated the team on their success.

42.title: Almost 100% Indians breathing polluted air: Report
42.article_body: Over 99% of India's population is breathing polluted air, a report by Greenpeace India stated on Friday. Most people living in India are exposed to PM2.5 concentrations, which is five times more than the annual average guideline prescribed by WHO. As per the report, most polluted region in India is Delhi-NCR, followed by Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana and West Bengal.

43.title: Mumbai's Lokmanya Tilak Terminus to get pod hotel
43.article_body: After Mumbai Central and Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT), the railways is planning to bring a large-sized pod hotel at Kurla's Lokmanya Tilak Terminus (LTT). "Pod hotels offer a comfortable and affordable overnight staying option to passengers at stations. At the Kurla LTT...it will be opened near the Passenger Reservation System (PRS) ticket counter," a railway official said.

44.title: Everyone in industry is saying 'bhakton ne barbad kar di': Vivek on 'Laal...'
44.article_body: Vivek Agnihotri, speaking about failure of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said, "Everyone in...industry is saying 'bhakton ne film ko barbad kar diya (bhakts ruined the film)'." "But...how many votes PM Narendra Modi gets? 40% okay? So let's take this 40-50% away...Where are...rest of...people?" he said, adding people didn't watch the film because they didn't know what it was all about.

45.title: Indian men's hockey team is now focussing on 2022-23 FIH Pro League: Surender
45.article_body: Indian men's hockey team defender Surender Kumar said his side is now focussing on 2022-23 FIH Hockey Pro League matches against New Zealand and Spain, beginning October 28. "We've to work hard and correct our mistakes in the camp now so that the mistakes don't happen again," he added. India won a silver medal at CWG 2022 last month.

46.title: Want to develop Rajasthan as centre of religious tourism: CM Gehlot
46.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Saturday said his government wants to develop the state as a centre of religious tourism. "The state government is committed to providing the devotees all kinds of facilities and security," he said. "All religious places in the state should be beautiful and equipped with all facilities," CM Gehlot added.

47.title: 2 cab drivers abduct, rape 25-yr-old woman in Bengaluru; arrested
47.article_body: Two cab drivers were arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly abducting and raping a 25-year-old woman on the pretext of dropping her to her destination, police said. The woman was reportedly walking on a road on Wednesday when she was approached by two bike-borne men, who took her to an isolated place and raped her. They also kept her in captivity.

48.title: Can't be a sentence less than life imprisonment for murder convict: SC
48.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday said that there cannot be any sentence/punishment less than life imprisonment, if an accused is convicted of murder. Justices MR Shah and Krishna Murari made the statement while quashing the judgement of Madhya Pradesh High Court, which had reduced the sentence of a murder convict from life imprisonment to the sentence already undergone by him.

49.title: Axar is correct like-to-like replacement for Jadeja at Asia Cup: Irfan
49.article_body: Commenting on Ravindra Jadeja being replaced by Axar Patel in India's squad for remainder of Asia Cup 2022, Irfan Pathan said the all-rounder is the "absolutely correct like-to-like replacement". He added, "Only problem is that Jadeja had become such a fantastic batter that you could've batted him up the order, you might not be able to do that with Axar."

50.title: 3, including a woman, killed as bike collides with truck in UP
50.article_body: Three people, including a woman, were killed in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra on Saturday after the motorcycle they were travelling on collided head-on with a truck, police said. The deceased were identified as 25-year-old Majmuddin Ansari, 27-year-old Ishtiyak Ansari and 30-year-old Gulabi. The trio died on the spot, while the truck driver escaped after the accident, SHO Lakshman Parvat said.

51.title: Efforts being made to defame Rajasthan: Gehlot on NCRB report
51.article_body: After the report of National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) was released, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said efforts are being made to defame the state. It would be appropriate to compare the figures of 2019 and 2021 as there was a lockdown in 2020, Gehlot said. "Uttar Pradesh is ahead in...murder cases, crime against women and kidnapping," he added.

52.title: 20-yr-old man dies after speeding BMW sports car falls off Yamuna Expressway in Noida
52.article_body: A 20-year-old man was killed while another was injured after a speeding BMW sports car spun out of control and fell off the Greater Noida Yamuna Expressway on Saturday morning. The incident happened near Galgotias University in Dankaur area. The accident took place at around 8.30 am when the two men, who hail from Haryana, were going towards Agra.

53.title: SC to hear plea on violence against doctors on Monday
53.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday will hear a plea seeking directions to ensure adequate security at hospitals and medical centres to deter attacks on doctors and healthcare workers, primarily by relatives of patients. The petition also seeks directions to Centre and states for the formation of a distress fund to grant compensation to victims of such violence or their families.

54.title: There's so much to learn from them: Mouni on co-stars Ranbir, Alia
54.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy in an interview said her 'Brahmastra' co-stars Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt are very disciplined and amazing human beings. "There's so much to learn from the two of them," Mouni said, adding, "One thing I tell everybody, whenever I get asked about Ranbir-Alia, is that they are fire. They light up on screen."

55.title: Drug smuggling accused arrested by Odisha Police from Ghaziabad
55.article_body: The main accused in a drug smuggling case was arrested by a Special Task Force (STF) team of Odisha Police from Ghaziabad on Thursday. The arrest was in connection with the seizure of 202 grams of cocaine worth around ₹50 lakh from Bhubaneswar in April this year. The Odisha Police team was assisted by UP Police in making the arrest.

56.title: Ousted SL Prez gets official residence, security on return: Officials
56.article_body: Sri Lanka's ousted President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was provided with an official residence and security by the government after he returned home on Saturday after fleeing the country in July, officials said. Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka on July 13 following mass protests amid the economic crisis. He had resigned after arriving in Singapore on July 14 and later travelled to Thailand.

57.title: Ayan has put a lot of energy into creating Astraverse: Rajamouli on Brahmastra
57.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, who was roped in to present Ayan Mukerji's directorial 'Brahmastra' in South, has said this kind of film needs to be supported. "When Ayan started narrating about these Astras to me, all my childhood fantasies came to life," he added. Rajamouli further said Ayan has put a lot of energy into creating 'Astraverse'.

58.title: Scindia urges states to lower VAT on aviation turbine fuel
58.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia urged states to reduce value-added tax (VAT) on aviation turbine fuel (ATF). He said only 16 of the 24 states had responded positively to this proposal, adding that ATF accounted for 40% of the airlines' cost structure. Scindia said currently only eight states are charging VAT at 20-30%, while 16 states charge 1-4% VAT rates.

59.title: He was always keen to take the ball: Rajkumar on Kohli's bowling
59.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's bowling, his childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said the India batter was always confident as a bowler. "Morne Morkel did dent his confidence a bit in...past (laughs) but he was always keen to take the ball...used to say- 'give me the ball, I will pick wickets'," he added. Kohli posted 1-0-6-0 against Hong Kong at Asia Cup.

60.title: Ghana man swallows 87 cocaine capsules worth ₹13 cr, held in Mumbai
60.article_body: The Customs department arrested a passenger from Ghana at the Mumbai airport for trying to smuggle cocaine into India by hiding it in 87 capsules that he had swallowed. The Customs said 1,300 grams of cocaine valued at ₹13 crore was recovered. The accused was reportedly admitted to a state-run hospital, where he ejected those capsules over three days.

61.title: PM Modi writes letter to UAE President to strengthen strategic ties
61.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has written a letter to UAE President Sheikh Mohamed Bin Zayed Al Nahyan to talk about further strengthening strategic relations between the countries. PM Modi's letter was delivered by EAM S Jaishankar when he met the UAE President in Dubai. According to UAE's news agency, the letter also talks of developing strategic relations to serve common interests.

62.title: Pune's Corbevax vaccine wastage rate higher than state average
62.article_body: Pune district's Corbevax vaccine wastage rate is higher than the state average as fresh COVID-19 cases continue to fall. While the vaccine wastage rate in Maharashtra is 13.31%, the wastage rate in Pune district is 13.86%. In Pune district, only 1,054 Corbevax doses have been used as precaution, said State Immunisation Officer Dr Sachin Desai.

63.title: T'gana BJP leader criticises Owaisi over 'China occupying 10 villages' remark
63.article_body: Telangana BJP leader NV Subhash criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi over his comments attacking the Centre. Subhash said Owaisi is spreading negativity, adding, "He is giving provocative and false statements." "I also hope INS Vikrant will give PM Narendra Modi the courage to speak up about China which has occupied 10 villages of our territory," Owaisi had said.

64.title: No rules violated: BJP's Nishikant Dubey on Deoghar airport incident
64.article_body: After being booked for forcing flight take-off at the Deoghar airport, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey rejected all the claims and said that there was no violation of rules. "File as many cases you want to file. A total of 37 cases have been filed against me and my family...This fight will continue for justice," said Dubey.

65.title: US customer data compromised in July cybersecurity breach: Samsung
65.article_body: Samsung Electronics said on Friday that the personal information of some customers in the US was compromised as it suffered a cybersecurity breach in late July. The company said that customers' social security numbers and credit card numbers were not affected, however, information including name, contact and demographic details, date of birth and product registration data had been compromised.

66.title: Cong to hold protest in Delhi on Sunday against price rise, GST
66.article_body: The Congress is set to hold a protest at Delhi's Ramlila Maidan on Sunday against price rise, unemployment and the GST hike on essential items. Rahul Gandhi and other party leaders would address the rally in which workers from Delhi, Haryana, UP and other parts of the country would participate. Sonia and Priyanka Gandhi would not be attending the event.

67.title: Couple's bodies recovered from rail tracks in UP, suicide suspected
67.article_body: The bodies of a 22-year-old man and a 19-year-old woman were recovered from railway tracks in Uttar Pradesh's Banda district. According to police, the two were in a relationship, however, their family members were against it as they belonged to different castes. They allegedly died by suicide by jumping in front of a moving train on Saturday, police added.

68.title: Russia sees over 50,000 new COVID-19 cases for 2nd straight day
68.article_body: For the second consecutive day on Saturday, Russia reported more than 50,000 new COVID-19 cases, with 51,699 testing positive. The country also recorded 92 coronavirus-related deaths over the last 24 hours, the government's coronavirus task force said. Russia reported 50,952 new COVID-19 cases on Friday, breaching the 50,000 mark for the first time in almost six months.

69.title: Very soon we will break JD(U)-RJD alliance in Bihar: BJP's Sushil Modi
69.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi has said, "Very soon, we will break the JD(U)-RJD alliance in Bihar and make the state JD(U) free." Commenting on five JD(U) MLAs joining BJP in Manipur, he said, "The state has become JD(U)-free. Those MLAs wanted to remain in NDA." He further said that nobody can become the PM by installing hoardings and posters.

70.title: We are determined to implement price cap on Russian oil: US
70.article_body: The US has said it is "determined" to enforce a price cap on Russian oil announced by G7 countries, even as Moscow said that it would stop selling oil to nations that impose price caps. "A price cap on Russian oil is a powerful tool...in our agenda to put downward pressure on global energy prices," White House Press Secretary said.

71.title: I'm ready to be a mom, explore a different version of myself: Serena
71.article_body: Following her loss in the last match of her career in US Open 2022 third round, 40-year-old Serena Williams said, "I'm ready to...be a mom, explore a different version of Serena." She added, "Technically in the world I'm still super young, so I want to have a little bit of a life while I'm still walking."

72.title: Hyd company to recycle Noida twin towers' waste into green building material
72.article_body: The 30,000 tonnes of debris left after the demolition of Noida's twin towers will be recycled into green building material by Hyderabad-based company Re Sustainability Ltd. It'll process 300 tonnes of waste, including concrete, steel and iron per day at its Noida plant. "We're looking forward to witnessing magnificent infrastructure developed using...recycled material," the company CEO said.

73.title: 7-yr-old Thane boy drowns in lake meant for Ganesh idol immersions
73.article_body: A seven-year-old boy, Jaihad Azhar Shaikh, from Rabodi in Thane drowned in a lake meant for Ganesh idol immersions on Friday night, an official said. The incident took place at Ambe-Ghosale Lake when the deceased went for a swim at 8 pm, chief of Thane civic body's Regional Disaster Management Cell said. He added that the body was recovered.

74.title: Mysterious explosion in Hyd leaves house with no walls, couple injured
74.article_body: A mysterious explosion in a house on the first floor of a building in Ramgopalpet in Secunderabad left the house with no walls. Other parts of the building were also damaged in the incident. A couple living in the house was seriously injured and was shifted to a local hospital. CCTV visuals reportedly showed the moment of the blast.

75.title: Nora Fatehi might be interrogated again: Delhi Police on extortion case
75.article_body: Economic Offences Wing of Delhi Police is likely to call actor Nora Fatehi once again for questioning in connection with ₹200 crore extortion case allegedly involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. "She was cooperating during the investigation but there are some questions whose answers have not been found yet and there might be a need to inquire her again," said an official.

76.title: 3 labourers die after stone slabs fall at construction site in Jaipur
76.article_body: At least three labourers were killed and one got injured on Friday evening after stone slabs fell on them at a construction site in the Jagatpura area in Rajasthan's Jaipur, police said. The incident took place when the victims were shifting granite stones to a loader. Notably, the labourers were engaged in the construction of a private hospital.

77.title: 12-yr-old electrocuted in Greater Noida Ganesh Chaturthi fair, organiser held
77.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was allegedly killed by electrocution at a fair organised on the occasion of Ganesh Chaturthi in Greater Noida on Thursday. An organiser of the fair has been arrested in the case. "The post-mortem report of the deceased indicates that he died due to electric shock to his body," said Abhishek Verma, Deputy Commissioner of Police, Greater Noida.

78.title: Suspended Telangana MRO found dead at her residence in Hyderabad
78.article_body: A suspended Telangana Mandal Revenue Officer (MRO), Sujatha, who was arrested in a land scam two years ago, was allegedly found dead under suspicious circumstances at her residence in Hyderabad on Saturday. The cause of her death is yet to be ascertained. Sujatha's family member claimed that she was undergoing treatment for dengue and suffered a cardiac arrest.

79.title: 42-year-old man found hanging in police custody in J&K's Rajouri
79.article_body: A 42-year-old man, booked in two separate cases, was found hanging in a police lock-up in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Friday, said SSP Choudhary Mohammad Aslam. "He had made a sort of rope with the help of threads from a curtain and this morning, was found hanging from the window of the washroom," said Aslam.

80.title: Kejriwal 'biggest U-turn leader' in India: BJP leader Tejasvi Surya
80.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya on Saturday termed AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal the "biggest U-turn leader" in the country. "Arvind Kejriwal's politics is without credibility and integrity," he added. "Certainly, the youths of Gujarat will not provide even an inch of space for revdi (freebie) and bevdi (drunk) politics," Surya said while referring to the Excise Policy of the Delhi government.

81.title: 3 burglars held, valuables worth ₹33 lakh recovered in Hyderabad
81.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Saturday solved a case of burglary and arrested three persons in connection with the case. The Rachakonda Police tweeted that 36 tolas of gold ornaments, nine wrist watches, one digital camera, one two-wheeler, 405 US dollars and one mobile phone worth ₹33.02 lakh were recovered. The accused had reportedly broken into a house on August 31.

82.title: Jacqueline made conman Sukesh pay ₹15 lakh to writer for web series script: ED
82.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate, in its supplementary chargesheet filed against Jacqueline Fernandez, claimed she admitted that conman Sukesh Chandrashekar gave ₹15 lakh in cash to writer Advaita Kala for a web series script. This contradicts her earlier statement to the investigating agency that she gave only chocolates and flowers to Kala. The transaction is now part of ED investigation.

83.title: After Paras Kalnawat, co-star Alma Hussein exits 'Anupamaa'
83.article_body: Actress Alma Hussein, who played the character of Sara Kapadia in 'Anupamaa', has quit the show. Talking about her exit, she said her "track was going nowhere" and she wasn't growing as an actor.  Earlier, actor Paras Kalnawat exited the show to participate in reality show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10'. Paras played the role of Samar Shah in 'Anupamaa'.

84.title: Punjab man opens fire after arguing with neighbour over dog's poop
84.article_body: A man, his father and other accomplices allegedly opened fire at his neighbour's house in Punjab's Ludhiana on Friday after arguing with the neighbour who objected to the man's dog defecating near his house. The accused, who are yet to be arrested, reportedly fired two shots. The police have recovered two bullet shells from the spot.

85.title: Merger of Manipur JD(U) MLAs into BJP was done using money power: Lalan Singh
85.article_body: JD(U) chief Lalan Singh accused BJP of horse trading in Manipur. "Whatever happened in Manipur (merger of JD(U) MLAs into BJP) was done by BJP using money power. For the PM, coming together of Opposition parties is corruption," he said. JD(U) will become a national party no matter how hard the Bharatiya Janata Party tries to stop it, Singh claimed.

86.title: 2,000 farmers died by suicide in Telangana from 2017 to 2019: FM
86.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday criticised the Telangana government saying that at least 2,000 farmers died by suicide in the state between 2017 and 2019. "There is gross injustice being done to the farmers," she said, adding that the condition of farmers wasn't as good as the TRS government claims it to be.

87.title: Day temperature in Pune city to rise over next few days: IMD
87.article_body: The day temperature in Pune city is likely to rise over the next few days, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. "Day temperature in the city is likely to touch 34°C till September 4. Partly cloudy skies becoming generally cloudy towards the afternoon and light rainfall for the city are forecast till the end of this week," an official said.

88.title: 2-year-old girl dies after water tanker hits motorcycle in Thane
88.article_body: A two-year-old girl was killed when a water tanker hit a motorcycle in Bhiwandi, Thane. The deceased, Khatija Khan, was travelling on the motorcycle with her parents and minor sister, who also got injured in the accident, police said. The tanker owner, Pramnath Bagal, and the driver, Jairam Jaiswal, have been booked under culpable homicide charges.

89.title: Milan airport dog sniffs out 13 kg of cocaine hidden in wheelchair
89.article_body: A sniffer dog helped police at Malpensa Airport in Italy's Milan find some 13 kilograms of cocaine stuffed into the leather upholstery of a motorised wheelchair. Following the discovery, the wheelchair user, who was pretending to be a disabled person, immediately got up and walked unaided, the Financial Guard police said. The seized cocaine was worth around £1.2 million.

90.title: Actress Manju Warrier joins Ajith for a bike trip in Ladakh, shares pics
90.article_body: Actress Manju Warrier took to Instagram to share a few pictures with actor Ajith Kumar as they went on an adventurous bike tour in Ladakh. She wrote, "Huge thanks to...Super Star Rider Ajith Kumar Sir! This is the first time I'm doing a tour on a two-wheeler." The duo will be seen together in an upcoming film tentatively titled 'AK61'.

91.title: Defending champion Medvedev to face 23rd seed Kyrgios in US Open 4th round
91.article_body: Defending champion Daniil Medvedev defeated China's Wu Yibing 6-4, 6-2, 6-2 to reach the men's singles fourth round at US Open 2022. The top seed will now face 23rd seed Nick Kyrgios, who reached the fourth round at US Open for the first time in his career. The Australian beat American wildcard JJ Wolf 6-4, 6-2, 6-3 in third round.

92.title: Hybrid LeT terrorist arrested in J&K, arms & ammunition recovered
92.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police along with security forces arrested a hybrid terrorist of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) in the Sopore region of Kashmir, police said on Saturday. The terrorist, identified as Saqib Shakeel Dar, was planning to carry out attacks on security forces and civilians, police added. One pistol, one magazine and eight pistol rounds were recovered from him.

93.title: Pune's Chandani Chowk flyover may open by June 2023: Nitin Gadkari
93.article_body: Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari has directed the authorities to complete the work on Pune's Chandani Chowk flyover by June 2023. He assured if issues about land acquisition for the project are resolved and land is acquired at two places (where it's currently facing resistance), the flyover will be launched by next year.

94.title: India's forex reserves fall by $3 billion to $561.04 billion
94.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell by $3 billion to $561.04 billion in the week ended August 26, according to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) data. The fall was because of a decline in the foreign currency assets (FCA) and the gold reserves. The FCA fell by $2.57 billion in the said week and gold reserves fell by $271 million.

95.title: 15 houses, 3 shops destroyed as cloudburst hits Dharamshala, rescue ops underway
95.article_body: Three shops and 15 houses were damaged after a cloudburst triggered flash floods in Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala on Friday. Reports said that 45 sheep and goats also went missing. Senior officials directed relief workers to ramp up rehabilitation efforts. "Damage caused by rains is being reviewed and effective steps are being taken by district administration," Kangra Deputy Commissioner said.

96.title: Paytm, Razorpay's Bengaluru offices raided by ED in Chinese loan apps case
96.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it's conducting raids at the Bengaluru offices of Paytm, Razorpay and Cashfree Payments in connection with "illegal" instant loan apps "controlled" by Chinese persons. The culprits were generating proceeds of crime through various accounts with payment gateways. This comes after several complaints of extortion by people who took loans through such apps.

97.title: Don't quit BJP, work for AAP internally: Kejriwal tells Guj BJP workers
97.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday appealed to BJP workers in Gujarat to work for Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) while staying in BJP. "Take...payment from there (BJP) but work for us...because we don't have money," he added. Kejriwal said BJP workers will benefit from all the "guarantees" promised by him to the people when AAP comes to power in Gujarat.

98.title: Video shows BJP MLA shouting at, threatening woman activist in B'luru
98.article_body: A video has emerged showing BJP MLA Aravind Limbavali shouting at and threatening a woman activist who was protesting against the demolition of a property in Bengaluru. The woman, Ruth Sagai Mary, was heard saying, "I'm talking with respect. You're speaking to a lady." Limbavali replied, "You've encroached the land...You want respect?" He asked the police to "take her away".

99.title: SC gives Finance Ministry 30 days more to open GST common portal
99.article_body: The Supreme Court has given the Finance Ministry a 30-day extension for opening of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) common portal. It also directed the GSTN to open a common portal for all taxpayers from October 1 till December 31. This would allow taxpayers to claim pending transitional credit due at the GST launch in 2017.

100.title: Canadian TikTok star Tanya Pardazi dies aged 21 in skydiving accident
100.article_body: Canadian TikTok star Tanya Pardazi died in a skydiving accident on August 27. According to the 21-year-old former Miss Canada semi-finalist's friends, Pardazi died while performing the activity in Ontario, Canada. Pardazi opened her parachute too late while in the air during her first solo course, according to a statement by the skydiving company.

101.title: Will Smith showed he's as ugly as rest of us: Dave Chappelle on Oscars slap
101.article_body: Comedian Dave Chappelle on his England tour with Chris Rock spoke about the latter being slapped by Will Smith at the 2022 Oscars. Dave said onstage, "A lot of people forget who Will Smith is...Will did the impression of a perfect person for 30 years and he...showed us he was as ugly as the rest of us."

102.title: People who abuse PM are crying about freedom of expression: Kiren Rijiju
102.article_body: Reacting to retired SC judge Justice BN Srikrishna's "freedom of expression" remark, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said that people who abuse the popularly elected PM are crying about freedom of expression. In an interview, Srikrishna had said, "If I say that I don't like the face of PM, somebody might raid me, arrest me, throw me in the jail."

103.title: Youth hacks leopard to death after it pounces on him in Kerala
103.article_body: A tribal youth hacked a leopard to death in Kerala's Idukki on Saturday in alleged self-defence, forest officials said. The youth, who suffered injuries and was admitted to a hospital, used a machete-like weapon to attack the leopard after it pounced on him and mauled him. "A detailed probe would be held," Mankulam Divisional Forest Officer G Jayachandran said.

104.title: Pic made using AI wins art prize in US; criticised by artists
104.article_body: Several artists are criticising the decision to award the first prize to an AI-generated artwork in the digital art category in the Colorado State Fair's annual art competition. Jason Allen used an AI program called Midjourney to create the art and touched it up a bit. "I'm not going to apologise...I won, and I didn't break any rules," said Allen.

105.title: FBI found over 11,000 govt records at Trump's home, unsealed records show
105.article_body: The FBI recovered more than 11,000 government documents and photographs, including 18 labelled as 'top secret', during its August 8 search at ex-US President Donald Trump's Florida home, according to court records that were unsealed on Friday. The FBI also seized 90 empty folders, 48 of which were marked 'classified' and 42 were labelled 'Return to Staff Secretary/Military Aide'.

106.title: Man arrested for raping 15-yr-old girl in Thane
106.article_body: A 19-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping and threatening a 15-year-old girl in Thane. The accused, Sameer Khan, used to stalk the girl, who was also his neighbour, and tried to speak to her multiple times, police said. The accused forcefully entered the victim's house last week when the latter's parents were away and allegedly committed the crime.

107.title: Motorcyclist killed after drunk woman mows him down in Delhi; arrested
107.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was arrested on Friday in East Delhi for allegedly mowing down a motorcyclist under the influence of alcohol, police said. The accident took place on NH-9 in East Vinod Nagar. The man, identified as 28-year-old Shakarpur resident Abhishek Kapoor, was rushed to MAX Hospital in Patparganj but was declared brought dead. A case has been registered.

108.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 men with 1.3 kg heroin worth ₹2 crore
108.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two men in Rohini with 1.3 kilograms of heroin worth ₹2 crore. One of the accused earlier spent five years in jail in connection with a robbery at Lahori Gate in 2014, police said. The second accused is a childhood friend of the first and was earlier arrested in a case under the Excise Act, police added.

109.title: Hrithik Roshan to sport 3 different looks for 'Vikram Vedha', pics surface
109.article_body: Pictures have surfaced on social media which show actor Hrithik Roshan in his upcoming film 'Vikram Vedha'. As per reports, the actor will be seen sporting three different looks for the film to show the backstory of his character Vedha. The film is touted to be an action-thriller directed by filmmaking duo Pushkar-Gayatri and also features Saif Ali Khan.

110.title: Massive eviction drive to clear 330 acres of land underway in Assam
110.article_body: A massive eviction and anti-encroachment drive began in Assam's Sonitpur on Saturday morning to clear 330 acres of land. Over 1,000 security personnel have been deployed, state IGP (L&O) PK Bhuyan said. As most residents have vacated their houses, heavy machinery is being used to demolish the structures. According to government records, 299 families were living there, reported PTI.

111.title: Gujarat AAP chief Gopal Italia booked for defaming BJP leaders
111.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's Gujarat President Gopal Italia has been booked for allegedly defaming BJP leaders, including the state's MoS Home Harsh Sanghavi and party's state chief CR Paatil. The complainant alleged that Italia called Sanghavi "Drugs Sanghavi" and Paatil a "former bootlegger". He further claimed that the AAP leader incited the public against the state.

112.title: I have shut it out of life: Karan Johar on boycott Bollywood trend
112.article_body: Speaking about the boycott Bollywood trend on social media, filmmaker Karan Johar said that he has shut it out of life and chooses to focus only on positivity. He added that by listening and reacting to negative things, you attract the same energy. "I think that you have to turn a blind eye towards negativity in general," the filmmaker said.

113.title: When I look at Rahul's body language, I feel he can't do anything: RP Singh
113.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh said Rishabh Pant should be picked in the lineup for Team India's upcoming match against Pakistan, going on to name KL Rahul as the player who should be rested. "Rahul isn't showing much promise. When I look at his body language, it feels he can't do anything," added Singh. "His...reading of match situations [is]...concerning," he stated.

114.title: 3 auto drivers rob man of phone, cash in Pimpri-Chinchwad; arrested
114.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police on Friday arrested three autorickshaw drivers who allegedly robbed a man of his phone and cash worth a total of ₹16,000. The incident took place on Tuesday when the man, who is a construction worker, hired an autorickshaw to travel from Alandi to Dudulgaon. A police sub-inspector said that the trio had threatened the man.

115.title: 'Danielle' becomes first Atlantic hurricane this year, moving at 120 km/hr
115.article_body: Tropical storm 'Danielle' has strengthened into the first hurricane of 2022 Atlantic Ocean season, the US National Hurricane Center said. The storm, which became a hurricane just before 10:50 am Eastern time on Friday, doesn't present immediate threat to land. It was about 1,440 km west of the Azores in the North Atlantic with maximum sustained winds of 120 km/hr.

116.title: We are mulling India listing: Nasdaq-listed MakeMyTrip’s Founder
116.article_body: MakeMyTrip Founder and Chairman Deep Kalra said the travel aggregator is thinking of getting listed in India. "When we listed in 2010, India was not ready for internet stocks," he said. Kalra also said that some of the internet companies which went public last year in India may have been misguided. The Nasdaq-listed MakeMyTrip settled at $33 apiece on Thursday.

117.title: Citi cuts mortgage team's size amid housing market slowdown in US
117.article_body: Citigroup on Friday said it has fired some workers of its mortgage team "due to internal streamlining of functions" and is helping affected workers find new roles "within Citi or outside the firm". Reportedly, less than 100 positions were affected by the job cuts. This comes as increasing prices and mortgage rates have slowed down the housing market in US.

118.title: Thanks Serena Williams for everything you've done for our sport: Nadal
118.article_body: After 23-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams played the last match of her career at US Open 2022, Rafael Nadal took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "Thanks Serena Williams for everything you've done for our sport!!! Amazing champion." Unseeded Australian Ajla Tomljanovic beat Serena 7-5, 6-7(4-7), 6-1 in the third round in New York today.

119.title: Skyroot Aerospace raises $51 million in funding round led by GIC
119.article_body: Hyderabad-based space-tech startup Skyroot Aerospace has raised around $51 million in a Series B financing round led by GIC. GIC's India Managing Director Mayank Rawat will now join Skyroot's board. This is the largest funding round ever in the Indian space-tech sector, the company said. Skyroot Aerospace was founded by Pawan Kumar Chandana and Naga Bharath Daka in 2018.

120.title: Crypto firm's CEO, who faces 40,000-yr jail for stealing $2 bn, arrested in Albania
120.article_body: Turkish cryptocurrency exchange platform Thodex's CEO Faruk Fatih Özer, accused of stealing $2 billion from thousands of clients, has been arrested in Albania, said Turkey. Further, the process to extradite Özer, who fled Turkey after Thodex was shut down last year, has started. He, along with other executives of Thodex, faces over 40,000 years in prison for alleged fraud.

121.title: Age is not what body tells you, but what your mind tells body: Sachin as Serena retires
121.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to congratulate Serena Williams following her retirement aged 40. He wrote, "Age is not what the body tells you...but what your mind tells the body. Teenagers can solve world's biggest problems, adults can pick up something new & excel." He added, "Sport inspires society to push limits & achieve the impossible....Congratulations on an inspiring career."

122.title: I love being objectified, I'm just a piece of meat: Ranveer Singh
122.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh made an appearance on reality show 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' in which he said, "I love being objectified. I am just a piece of meat. Just a battery-operated device." He also complimented Sanjay Kapoor's wife Maheep Kapoor over her appearance in 1994 music video 'Nigori Kaisi Jawani Hai', saying she looked like a malai kofta.

123.title: Security beefed up in Goshamahal in view of bandh over Raja Singh's arrest
123.article_body: In view of the shutdown called by supporters of suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh, Hyderabad Police has beefed up security in parts of Goshamahal constituency. "Why a hate speaker like Owaisi was not held under the Preventive Detentions (PD) Act and why only Raja Singh has been held under it? Government [is working] with AIMIM," said Sri Ram Yuva Sena.

124.title: Goa Police recovers 3 diaries from Sonali Phogat’s Haryana residence
124.article_body: Goa Police have recovered three diaries from the Haryana residence of late TikTok star and BJP leader Sonali Phogat. Police also inspected Sonali's bedroom, wardrobe, and password-protected locker. The locker has been sealed by the police, reports said. "We are still investigating and scrutinizing the case...a conclusion can only be drawn once we are through with investigation," police said.

125.title: Revoke or face 'counter-measures': China to US on $1.1 bn arms package to Taiwan
125.article_body: China on Friday warned the US to revoke the $1.1 billion arms package to Taiwan and warned the country of "counter-measures" on failing to do so. It added that the aid to Taiwan "severely jeopardises" the relations between the US and China. "China will resolutely take legitimate and necessary counter-measures," Chinese embassy spokesman Liu Pengyu said.

126.title: Ranveer Singh makes his first startup investment, invests in SUGAR Cosmetics
126.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has made his first startup investment by investing in beauty products startup SUGAR Cosmetics. The startup announced the actor's investment on Saturday, however, it didn't disclose the amount of investment. Founded by IIM Ahmedabad alumni Vineeta Singh and Kaushik Mukherjee, the startup sells cosmetics through both online and offline routes. In May, it raised $50 million.

127.title: Motherf*cker hit me over nicest joke I ever told: Chris Rock on Oscars slap
127.article_body: Comedian Chris Rock during his comedy show with Dave Chappelle in England joked with the audience about the 2022 Oscars slap incident. He said, "Did that sh*t hurt? Goddamn right. The motherf*cker hit me over a bullsh*t joke, the nicest joke I ever told." Chris had joked about Will Smith's wife Jada Pinkett Smith's lack of hair due to alopecia.

128.title: Develop State Capital Region on lines of Delhi-NCR: UP CM to officials
128.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has directed officials to form 'Uttar Pradesh State Capital Region (SCR)' along the lines of the Delhi-National Capital Region (NCR). During a review meeting, Yogi said the population pressure is increasing in the neighbouring districts of Lucknow. Therefore, keeping future requirements in mind, Lucknow and its surrounding districts can be developed into an SCR, Yogi added.

129.title: Expanding anus by hands & pouring substance in it, prima facie not carnal intercourse: HC
129.article_body: Bombay High Court observed that act of "expanding the anus by hands and pouring some substance into it, prima facie cannot be said to be...carnal intercourse". The court said this while granting bail to a man accused of unnatural offences against a seven-year-old girl. The court noted that no injuries to the anus were recorded in her medical report.

130.title: Amazon's $1.7 billion takeover of iRobot under review in US: Report
130.article_body: US' Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has reportedly started reviewing Amazon's $1.7 billion deal to acquire Roomba vacuum maker iRobot. The wide-ranging review will analyse whether the deal will illegally boost Amazon's market share in both the connected device market and the retail market in general, Politico reported citing sources. The all-cash deal was announced last month.

131.title: Man dies as 25 gunny bags full of rice fall on him in godown in Tamil Nadu
131.article_body: A 35-year-old man died after 25 gunny bags full of rice fell on him in a godown in Tamil Nadu's Periyapalayam. Reports said he had been asked to stack the bags on the shelves. He reportedly sat down to rest when the bags came falling down on him. A few employees rushed to incident site after they heard his voice.

132.title: Big B shares poster, release date of 'Goodbye' with Rashmika
132.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan on Saturday took to social media to share the poster of his upcoming film 'Goodbye' which also features Rashmika Mandanna and Neena Gupta. He wrote alongside the poster that the film will release in theatres on October 7. He can be seen flying a kite in the poster as Rashmika holds the kite spool.

133.title: Audience wants more than what we're delivering: Jr NTR on film industry
133.article_body: Speaking about the failures faced by the Indian film industry, actor Jr NTR said that the audience wants more than what they are delivering. He further said that the film industry is under pressure and needs to accept this challenge to make better films for the audience. "Not putting anybody down here. Let's accept the challenge," the actor added.

134.title: Gunmen kidnap worshippers attending prayers at mosque in Nigeria
134.article_body: Gunmen have kidnapped dozens of worshippers attending Friday afternoon prayers at a mosque in Zamfara state in Nigeria, police said. "The Zamfara state police command in collaboration with military and vigilantes have dispatched personnel for the search and rescue operation," a police spokesman said. The men were reportedly disguised as worshippers and hid the guns under their garments.

135.title: MP govt exempts students of 1.30 lakh schools from carrying bags once a week
135.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government has decided to exempt students of 1.30 lakh schools from carrying bags once a week. MP has 1.30 lakh schools with a collective strength of 1.54 crore students, an official said. The students of Classes 1-2 will have to carry school bags weighing 1.6 to 2.2 kg while students of Classes 3-5, weighing 1.7 to 2.5 kg.

136.title: Venus Williams is the only reason I ever existed: Serena Williams
136.article_body: Following her 5-7, 7-6(7-4), 1-6 defeat against Australia's Ajla Tomljanović in the US Open's third round, marking her career's last match, Serena Williams said her sister Venus Williams is the "only reason" she ever existed. "It's been the most incredible...journey I've ever been on...in my life," added Serena. "It all started with my parents and they deserved everything," she stated.

137.title: Madrassa caretaker in Hyd arrested for sexually assaulting student
137.article_body: A madrassa caretaker has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a 14-year-old student in Hyderabad. The accused, identified as Qasim, was booked under POCSO Act after the victim's mother filed a complaint with the police. The minor boy was reportedly assaulted several times and was threatened with dire consequences if he revealed the ordeal to anyone.

138.title: India pips UK, our colonial ruler: Kotak on India becoming 5th largest economy
138.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak said it is a "proud moment for India to pip UK, our colonial ruler" to become the world's fifth largest economy. "But a reality check of population denominator: India: 1.4 bn vs UK: 0.068 bn. Hence, per capita GDP we [are] at $2,500 vs $47,000. We've miles to go," Kotak wrote in a tweet.

139.title: Nitish 'lame duck CM': BJP leader as 5 JD(U) MLAs join BJP in Manipur
139.article_body: After five of the six JD(U) MLAs in Manipur joined the BJP on Friday, BJP leader Amit Malviya called Bihar CM Nitish Kumar a "lame duck CM". He also claimed that Kumar "is seeing his party's footprint shrink, not just in Bihar, where it is the third largest, but also outside", yet is still dreaming about becoming the Prime Minister.

140.title: 1.45 lakh litre of raw material for illicit liquor destroyed in Punjab
140.article_body: Punjab's excise department recovered and destroyed 1.45 lakh litre of lahan, raw material used to make illicit liquor, on the spot outside river banks in Ludhiana on Friday. State minister Harpal Singh Cheema said, "[Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann-led government] will continue to break...back of liquor mafia and nobody involved will be spared." Drones were used in the search operation.

141.title: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank raises ₹363 crore from anchor investors
141.article_body: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank said it has raised ₹363.53 crore from anchor investors before its initial public offering (IPO) that will open for subscription on September 5. A total of 71,28,000 equity shares have been allotted to anchor investors at ₹510 apiece, it said. Nomura, Societe Generale, Max Life Insurance and Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance are some of the anchor investors.

142.title: I want people to know me as Shehnaaz now, not 'Punjab ki Katrina': Shehnaaz
142.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill stated she wants the tag of 'Punjab ki Katrina' to go away because she wants to make her identity as Shehnaaz Gill now. "Katrina Kaif is Katrina Kaif and I like her so much but I want...people to know me as Shehnaaz," she added. She is set to make her Bollywood debut with Salman Khan.

143.title: CM in denial: NCW chief after Gehlot says 50% rape charges in Raj false
143.article_body: After Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that around 50% rape charges in the state are false, National Commission for Women (NCW) chief Rekha Sharma said Gehlot is denying the actual data regarding his state. "Exactly with the same mindset, his police works and that is why women in the state don't get justice," Rekha Sharma tweeted on Saturday.

144.title: Appalled by unruly conduct of FM Sitharaman with Collector: KTR
144.article_body: After Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman questioned Kamareddy District Collector Jitesh Patil over the absence of PM Narendra Modi's pictures at fair price shops, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said, "I am appalled by [Sitharaman's] unruly conduct." He also complimented Patil on his "dignified conduct", adding, "These political histrionics...will only demoralise hardworking AIS officers."

145.title: Kyrgyzstan's 1st female President named UN envoy to Afghanistan
145.article_body: Roza Otunbayeva, Kyrgyzstan's first female President, has been appointed as the new UN special envoy for Afghanistan. Otunbayeva, who served as Kyrgyzstan's President from 2010 to 2011, will replace Canada's Deborah Lyons. "Otunbayeva brings to the position over 35 years of...experience in leadership, diplomacy, civic engagement and international cooperation," UN chief António Guterres said.

146.title: One of the biggest upsets: Sehwag on Zimbabwe's historic win vs Aus
146.article_body: Discussing Zimbabwe's historic win against Australia on Australian soil in ODIs, Virender Sehwag tweeted, "One of the biggest upsets in...ODI cricket." "Well done Zimbabwe [on]...beating a full strength Australian side...Feels good when an underdog does well," added Sehwag. Australia had beaten Zimbabwe in 12 out of 13 ODI matches played between the teams in Australia before this game.

147.title: 'KGF 2' f*cked up everything, nobody in B'wood liked it: Ram Gopal Varma
147.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma in an interview stated that nobody in Bollywood liked Yash-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'. The filmmaker further stated that a very big director of Bollywood said he tried to watch it five times but couldn't go beyond half an hour. "Two films that have f**ked up everything are 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' and 'The Kashmir Files'," he added.

148.title: Chidambaram calls Teesta Setalvad 'a courageous fighter for justice'
148.article_body: Congress MP P Chidambaram praised Supreme Court for its decision to grant interim bail to activist Teesta Setalvad and called her "a courageous fighter for justice".  Earlier on Friday, the SC had granted interim bail to the activist in a case in which she was arrested for allegedly fabricating documents to frame innocent people in the 2002 Gujarat riots cases.

149.title: Voting closes in UK PM race between Sunak & Truss; result on Sept 5
149.article_body: The voting in the Conservative Party leadership race between Rishi Sunak and Liz Truss to replace Boris Johnson as Britain's next PM closed on Friday. The result will be announced on September 5 at 12:30 pm BST (17:00 pm IST). The winner will be formally appointed PM on September 6 by Queen Elizabeth II at Balmoral, her castle in Scotland.

150.title: 'Brahmāstra' pre-release event cancelled in Hyd; Rajamouli, Jr NTR apologise
150.article_body: The pre-release event of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra' scheduled for Friday at Hyderabad's Ramoji Rao studios was cancelled at the last minute. Actor Jr NTR was to appear as the chief guest. Filmmaker SS Rajamouli apologised for the cancellation, saying that police personnel were busy on duty due to Ganesh Chaturthi. Jr NTR also apologised for the cancellation.

151.title: Aim to transform Jammu as eco-city for sustainable economic activities: LG Sinha
151.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha said that his aim is to transform Jammu into an eco-city for sustainable economic activities. "Inaugurated and laid the foundation stone of 14 projects of Jammu Smart city. These projects will create a smart living by improving quality of life, better public services, opportunities for local economic development and easier accessibility to everyone," said Sinha.

152.title: Udaipur cook asks students to throw meals served by Dalit girls, arrested
152.article_body: A cook was arrested for allegedly asking students in a government school to throw mid-day meals reportedly served by two Dalit girls in Rajasthan's Udaipur, police said. "A case against the cook was registered under the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989," police added. "A prompt action was taken...the matter was found true," police stated.

153.title: Ex-Army jawan arrested over abusive posts against Gujarat BJP MLA
153.article_body: An ex-Army jawan, identified as Lakhanashi Odedara, was arrested on Friday for allegedly threatening Gujarat BJP MLA Babubhai Bokhiria and sharing abusive posts on social media against him. "Odedara was arrested after some persons pointed out to Porbandar MLA Bokhiria that he had used abusive language against him on Facebook," said a police official.

154.title: Shabana, Akhtar, Naseeruddin sleeper cells of 'tukde-tukde gang': MP minister
154.article_body: MP Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Friday called Bollywood artists Shabana Azmi, Javed Akhtar and Naseeruddin Shah the sleeper cells of the 'tukde-tukde gang'. The statement comes after Azmi broke down while talking about the release of Bilkis Bano's rape convicts during a TV interview. Mishra accused the artists of remaining silent on incidents that happen in Congress-ruled states.

155.title: LS Speaker Om Birla unveils Swami Vivekananda's 1st statue in Mexico
155.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Saturday unveiled the first statue of Swami Vivekananda in Mexico. "The statue will be a source of inspiration for people, especially for the youth of the region to strive and bring the change which will take their country to new prime," Om Birla tweeted.

156.title: Starc creates world record, becomes fastest bowler to take 200 wickets in ODI history
156.article_body: Australia fast bowler Mitchell Starc has become the fastest bowler to reach 200 wickets in ODI cricket, achieving the feat against Zimbabwe in the third ODI on Saturday. The 32-year-old reached the landmark in his 102nd ODI, breaking former Pakistan spinner Saqlain Mushtaq's record (104 matches). Starc is also the fastest bowler to reach 150 ODI wickets.

157.title: Ranveer danced shirtless with girls for 'Jayeshbhai...', it's not a comedy: Vivek
157.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has criticised actor Ranveer Singh over his promotions for 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'. He said, "Ranveer went shirtless and was dancing with 25 girls during the promotions." The filmmaker further said that it's not a fashion show or comedy. "Nobody knew that the film was about female foeticide...Why would people go and see that?" he added.

158.title: My ex-wife and I are very much in love: Actor Gulshan Devaiah
158.article_body: Actor Gulshan Devaiah has said that he and his ex-wife, actress Kallirroi Tziafeta, are "very much in love". "We just couldn't make it (the marriage) work. But, the love is there...Marriage is a responsibility...You have to constantly be willing to negotiate with each other...and that can be hard. That's the only reason we are divorced," he added.

159.title: Sachin came running & hugged me, it was massive: Kaif on NatWest final
159.article_body: Discussing India's win in the 2002 NatWest final against England, Mohammad Kaif said, "It was a massive feeling to see Sachin Tendulkar receiving us. He ran towards me." "The maximum reaction...you'd get from him...was a pat on the back," he added. "I was expecting him to do that, but rather, he opened his arms up to hug me," stated Kaif.

160.title: Journalist P Sainath to return award conferred on him by Murugha Mutt in 2017
160.article_body: Journalist and Ramon Magsaysay awardee P Sainath has said that he is returning the Basavashree award and ₹5 lakh prize money that was awarded to him by Karnataka's Murugha Mutt in 2017. This comes after arrest of Mutt's head seer, Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, in sexual assault case. Sainath said he is returning the award in solidarity with survivors in case.

161.title: Supreme Court disposed of over 1,000 cases in last 4 days: CJI Lalit
161.article_body: Chief Justice of India UU Lalit said the Supreme Court will endeavour to dispose of as many cases as possible. In the last four days, the Supreme Court has disposed of 1,293 miscellaneous matters and 106 regular hearing matters, CJI Lalit said on Friday. He added that about 440 transfer petitions were also wrapped up by the court.

162.title: Why should restaurants pay commission: NRAI on Swiggy, Zomato dine-in offers
162.article_body: National Restaurant Association of India (NRAI) asked members to "inspect the terms and conditions thoroughly and then make an informed decision" before joining Zomato and Swiggy's new dine-in programmes. The schemes offer discounts and allow customers to pay bills through apps. "Question here is why should a restaurant pay a commission...to offer a discount to its own customer?" NRAI argued.

163.title: Man tries to enter home on pretext of renting room, kills woman in Noida
163.article_body: Noida Police arrested a 25-year-old man on Friday after he allegedly tried to force his way into a woman's home under the pretext of renting a room and then killed her. The accused, who is unemployed, waited for everyone to leave the house before approaching the woman with the objective of robbing her, killing her in the process, police said.

164.title: Doctor starts performing C-section, stitches back Assam woman as baby was premature
164.article_body: A six-month pregnant woman in Assam is said to be critical after a doctor performing a C-section delivery stitched her cut back on realising the baby was premature. Dr AK Biswas of Karimganj Civil Hospital claimed the patient's family requested him to perform the surgery as she was in pain. A seven-member team has been formed to probe the matter.

165.title: Microsoft's combat goggles win 1st delivery approval from US Army
165.article_body: Microsoft will deliver its first batch of high-tech combat goggles to the US Army after the company received approval from Assistant Secretary for Acquisition Douglas Bush. The goggles, named  Integrated Visual Augmentation System (IVAS), will provide a heads-up display and night vision to soldiers. The Army could spend up to $21.9 billion on IVAS over the next decade.

166.title: I dare you to name encroachers of Bengaluru lake: Kumaraswamy to K'taka CM
166.article_body: Amid flood-like situation in parts of Bengaluru, JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy criticised CM Basavaraj Bommai and dared him to name the encroachers of Bengaluru lake and Rajakaluve. "Thousands of crores of rupees for the development of Rajakaluve has been taken. The CM says that money has been released. So to whom did the money go?" said Kumaraswamy.

167.title: MNS leaders who assaulted woman during argument in Mumbai get bail
167.article_body: A court granted bail to three leaders of Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) who had pushed and slapped an elderly woman in Mumbai's Kamathipura. This comes a day after they were arrested as a video of the incident went viral online. Speaking against their bail, the woman appealed to the Maharashtra government to initiate action against the accused.

168.title: Foreign Min Lavrov not given US visa yet for UN leaders meet: Russia
168.article_body: Russia has asked for 56 visas from the US to allow Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and his delegation to participate in the annual meeting of world leaders at the UN this month but hasn't received any. Russia's UN Ambassador Vassily Nebenzia said this was "alarming" and that the US, as the UN host country, is legally required to issue visas.

169.title: Man seeks ₹1,000 cr, claims Covishield killed daughter; HC sends notice to SII, Gates
169.article_body: The Bombay High Court has issued a notice in connection to a plea filed by a man seeking compensation of ₹1,000 crore from the Maharashtra government, the Union government, the Serum Institute of India (SII) and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates, for the death of his daughter. The man claimed his daughter died due to side effects from Covishield vaccine.

170.title: Pune provided 14 more slots for civil flights per day, says Scindia
170.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Friday that Defence Ministry has provided 14 additional slots for civil flight operations per day from Pune Airport. "Monday to Saturday slots have increased from 102 to 116 while...Sunday slots have increased from 131 to 145," he added. Furthermore, he said that Pune will soon get direct air connectivity with Singapore.

171.title: BJP's Nishikant Dubey, Manoj Tiwari booked for forced entry into ATC in Deoghar
171.article_body: BJP MPs Nishikant Dubey and Manoj Tiwari were among nine people booked for allegedly forcing their way into the Air Traffic Control (ATC) at Jharkhand's Deoghar airport. They have been accused of pressuring officials to give clearance for flight take-off, which was then provided. Dubey's two sons and Deoghar airport director have also been named in the FIR.

172.title: 5 JD(U) MLAs join BJP in Manipur weeks after party broke ties with BJP in Bihar
172.article_body: As many as five of six Janata Dal (United) MLAs in Manipur joined BJP on Friday, weeks after the party broke ties with BJP in Bihar. "Honourable Speaker of the Manipur Assembly accepted the merger of the five JD(U) MLAs to BJP namely Khumukcham Joykishan Singh, Ngursanglur Sanate, Md Achab Uddin, Thangjam Arunkumar and LM Khoute," BJP's Manipur unit tweeted.

173.title: 'Hold interviews at 11pm, on Sundays to hire people,' says Pristyn Care founder; criticised
173.article_body: Pristyn Care's Co-founder Harsimarbir Singh is facing criticism after he shared a LinkedIn post on "interesting interview hacks" used by the health-tech startup to find "special driven people". In the now-deleted post, Singh shared how Pristyn Care schedules interviews at 11pm and on Sundays to spot "late workers" and test their commitment and makes candidates spend 6-8 hours in office.

174.title: 70-year-old woman dies after falling off 11th floor in Gurugram
